definition[0]: to manage to get past or through something that is in your way
example[0]: Several demonstrators broke through the barriers despite warnings from the police.
example[1]: After hours of fierce fighting, rebels broke through and captured the capital.
definition[1]: if the sun breaks through, you can see it when you could not see it before because there were clouds
example[2]: The sun broke through at around lunch time.
example[3]: The sun soon broke through the mist.
definition[2]: to manage to do something successfully when there is a difficulty that is preventing you
example[4]: He’s a very talented young actor who’s just ready to break through.
example[5]: It is possible that at this election some of the minority parties might succeed in breaking through into parliament.
